content.description:
The Imposing double column directly across the Gully from the bottom of Mainstreet.  The opening moves seldom come in fat, so be prepared for some delicate mixed climbing off the ground.  Often better to wait for a good snow to pad your landing if you mess up.  Delicate moves take you through the first pillar on the left, and then you can choose to head straight up or traverse to the usually fatter right side to finish.  Terraces and thin pillars above.  Techy and engaging. 



Traverse the stream at the bottom of Mainstreet in iced conditions, or access via French Connection. Finding the top anchors can be dicey for top-roping. 

Thin ice rack and brown pants.

A nice bit of vert and a good warmup on the way in.  Climb the second Ice formation encountered descending Mainstreet up to a large tree.  Stay tuned for a mixed variant to the left. 



Second Ice Route descending Mainstreet. 

Standard Ice Rack

The first Ice you hit when descending Mainstreet.  climbs a short pillar, and then wraps right up to a gnarled tree. be aware of knocking ice on climbers transiting Mainstreet.



On the Mainstreet Gully Descent.

Standard Ice Rack

Climb the short pillar just before the base of Main Street Gully, rounding the corner at the top and traversing to the top of Cold Coffee. Often lens-ey and more technical than it looks.



Near the bottom of Mainstreet.

Standard Ice Rack
The main access gully for the crag.  Descent from the Gallery will generally funnel you into Mainstreet.  Also includes the climb Merger across the stream.
